name: Way of Mercy
description: Monks who have learned to manipulate life force to both heal and harm.

3.Implements of Mercy: You gain proficiency in Insight and Medicine skills, and proficiency with the Herbalism Kit.
3.Hand of Healing: As an action, you can spend 1 Ki to touch a creature and restore Hit Points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + Wisdom modifier. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can replace one unarmed strike with a use of Hand of Healing without spending Ki.
3.Hand of Harm: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 Ki to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + Wisdom modifier.

6.Physician's Touch: When you use Hand of Healing, you can also end one disease or Poisoned condition on the target. When you use Hand of Harm, you can impose the Poisoned condition on the target until the end of your next turn.

11.Flurry of Healing and Harm: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can now replace each of the unarmed strikes with a use of Hand of Healing (without spending Ki for Hand of Healing).

17.Hand of Ultimate Mercy: As an action, you can spend 5 Ki to touch a creature that has died within the past 24 hours and return it to life with Hit Points equal to 4d10 + Wisdom modifier. If the creature died while subject to any of the following conditions, it revives with them removed: Blinded, Deafened, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Stunned. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
